question: 中途半端
sourceMnemonic: Take the <kanji>middle</kanji> <kanji>route</kanji>, <kanji>half</kanji> to the <kanji>edge</kanji>. You don't do anything the full way. Just to the middle. Just to the half. Not to the edge. This was really <vocabulary>half finished</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>half assed</vocabulary> of you.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>ぱ</ja> at the end is the only tricky part here since that isn't a common reading (or the one you learned before) for the kanji. Just think of your ol' <reading>Pa</reading> (<ja>ぱ</ja>), who is the biggest half-asser you know.
